original: de dag kyang spyad nas ri rab kyi rtse mo spos brtsegs zhes bya ba rin po che sna bdun 'bar @292b ba lha'i 'byung khungs mu tig gi phreng ba rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa ltar 'bab chu dang / chu bo bye ma mu tig lta bu rnams kyis nye bar brgyan pa /
analyzed: de dag kyang spyad nas ri rab kyi rtse mo spos brtsegs zhes bya ba rin po che sna bdun 'bar @292b ba lha'i 'byung khungs mu tig gi phreng ba rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa ltar 'bab chu dang / chu bo bye ma mu tig lta bu rnams kyis nye bar brgyan pa /
translated: Having enjoyed those, they will go to the peak of Mount Sumeru called Stacked Incense, which is adorned with garlands of pearls and is the source of the gods’ jewels. It is adorned with waterfalls and rivers of sand that resemble pearls.

original: chu bo de dag gi 'gram gnyis ka na lha'i bya sgra 'byin cing shin tu blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: chu bo de dag gi 'gram gnyis ka na lha'i bya sgra 'byin cing shin tu blta na sdug pa /
translated: On both banks of those rivers are divine birds that sing and are extremely beautiful.

original: yid du 'ong zhing nyams dga' ba de dag na lha'i rgyal po brgya byin de lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas /
analyzed: yid du 'ong zhing nyams dga' ba de dag na lha'i rgyal po brgya byin de lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas /
translated: They are delightful and pleasing to the mind. There, Śakra, king of the gods, surrounded by a retinue of goddesses,

original: lha cha byad dang / gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa rnams rjes su 'brang zhing rtse bar byed do //
analyzed: lha cha byad dang / gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa rnams rjes su 'brang zhing rtse bar byed do //
translated: will enjoy himself with the gods, who have various divine forms and appearances.

original: de der yang yun ring du sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas rtses nas /
analyzed: de der yang yun ring du sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas rtses nas /
translated: Having enjoyed himself for a long time with the five types of musical instruments,

original: gzhal med khang skyed mos tshal gyis brgyan pa spyi bo zhes bya ba ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhal med khang skyed mos tshal gyis brgyan pa spyi bo zhes bya ba ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
translated: They will then proceed to the palace and park called Summit.

original: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs yid rab tu dga' ba dang lhan cig der dong ste phyin pa dang / gang lha gzhan 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas yid phrogs pa dag gnas gzhan dag na rtse bar byed la /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs yid rab tu dga' ba dang lhan cig der dong ste phyin pa dang / gang lha gzhan 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas yid phrogs pa dag gnas gzhan dag na rtse bar byed la /
translated: Together with the delighted hosts of gods and goddesses, they will arrive at the palace and park. While some of the gods are distracted by the five sense pleasures, they will continue to play in other places.

original: de dag skyed mos tshal spyi bo ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag skyed mos tshal spyi bo ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Then, they will proceed to the palace and park called Summit.

original: gzhal med khang dang / skyed mos tshal phun sum tshogs pa de'ang ri bo thams cad pas 'phang mtho la /
analyzed: gzhal med khang dang / skyed mos tshal phun sum tshogs pa de'ang ri bo thams cad pas 'phang mtho la /
translated: The palace and park is superior to all other mountains in terms of its height and abundance.

original: 'di ltar 'thab bral ba'i lha rnams kyi drung nas 'od gsal ba cung zad 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'thab bral ba'i lha rnams kyi drung nas 'od gsal ba cung zad 'byung ste /
translated: The light that shines from the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife is slightly brighter than that of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: ji ltar mi'i gnas bzhi rnams su ri rab las 'od gsal bar 'byung ba de ltar 'thab bral ba'i lha rnams kyi drung nas 'od gsal ba phyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar mi'i gnas bzhi rnams su ri rab las 'od gsal bar 'byung ba de ltar 'thab bral ba'i lha rnams kyi drung nas 'od gsal ba phyis 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the light that shines from Mount Sumeru is brighter than the light of the four human abodes, the light that shines from the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife is brighter than the light of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: 'jig rten spyi bo pa la 'od cung zad kyang med kyang 'jig rten spyi bo pa de stong 'gyur @293a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten spyi bo pa la 'od cung zad kyang med kyang 'jig rten spyi bo pa de stong 'gyur @293a *//
translated: Although the crown of the world has not even a little light,🔽that crown of the world is a thousand times empty.

original: du mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: du mdzes pa yin no //
translated: Even though the top of the world has not the slightest light, the top of the world is a thousand times more beautiful.

original: de nas der yang brgya byin gyis dus yun ring du rtses nas de nas yang de bzhin du lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas der yang brgya byin gyis dus yun ring du rtses nas de nas yang de bzhin du lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Then, after a long time, Śakra will play there again. Then, just as before, surrounded by a group of gods and goddesses, he will go to the divine assembly hall called Sudharmā.

original: zhib tu spyod pa'i lha de dag kyang lha'i gnas de dag na /🔽ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams kyis rtse bar byed /
analyzed: zhib tu spyod pa'i lha de dag kyang lha'i gnas de dag na / ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams kyis rtse bar byed /
translated: The gods who are engaged in detailed conduct

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: will play and enjoy themselves with the five divine objects of desire, as much as they like, for as long as the previously created and accumulated actions that are attractive, desirable, and delightful have not been exhausted.

original: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Later, they will die and leave that divine world.

original: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag par mchog tu bde ste rgyal po'am /
analyzed: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag par mchog tu bde ste rgyal po'am /
translated: After death, they will fall into the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts, in accordance with their karmic actions.

original: blon po chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: blon po chen por 'gyur /
translated: “If, due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, in accordance with their causal actions they will always be extremely happy. They will become kings or great ministers.🔽They will always have curly hair and be very handsome.

original: rtag tu skra zhing mo sdug gur 'khyil ba dang / rtag tu yid shin tu zab pa dang / thams cad kyis dka' bar bya ba rnams la don dang ldan par shes pa dang / rab tu mang por mi smra zhing nyung ngur smra ba dang /
analyzed: rtag tu skra zhing mo sdug gur 'khyil ba dang / rtag tu yid shin tu zab pa dang / thams cad kyis dka' bar bya ba rnams la don dang ldan par shes pa dang / rab tu mang por mi smra zhing nyung ngur smra ba dang /
translated: They will always have very deep minds, and they will understand the meaning of all difficult tasks. They will not speak much, but what they say will be meaningful.

original: rtag tu shin tu gos gtsang zhing dkar ba dang / chung ma mi g-yem pa dang / khyim thabs kyi gnas la dga' zhing khyim thab la dga' la @293b phyi rol du mi 'khyam pa dang / rtag tu sbyin pa la dga' zhing sems shin tu drang ba dang /
analyzed: rtag tu shin tu gos gtsang zhing dkar ba dang / chung ma mi g-yem pa dang / khyim thabs kyi gnas la dga' zhing khyim thab la dga' la @293b phyi rol du mi 'khyam pa dang / rtag tu sbyin pa la dga' zhing sems shin tu drang ba dang /
translated: They will always be very clean and wear white clothes, not have sex with other people’s wives, enjoy their own wives, and not wander outside. They will always enjoy giving and be very honest.

original: rang gi 'khor dang / mdza' ba shes dang / rtsa la ga la dga' ba dang / bla ma la dga' ba dang / tshes grangs la dga' ba dang / rang gi bud med la dga' ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / gzhan gyi bud med la mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: rang gi 'khor dang / mdza' ba shes dang / rtsa la ga la dga' ba dang / bla ma la dga' ba dang / tshes grangs la dga' ba dang / rang gi bud med la dga' ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / gzhan gyi bud med la mi dga' ba dang /
translated: They will enjoy their own retinue, friends, and relatives, enjoy their gurus, enjoy the holy days, enjoy their own wives, be moral, and not enjoy other people’s wives.

original: spos dang / phreng ba la dga' ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po la mi dga' ba dang / rigs dma' bar mi skye ba dang / gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rgyan bzang por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: spos dang / phreng ba la dga' ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po la mi dga' ba dang / rigs dma' bar mi skye ba dang / gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rgyan bzang por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: They will enjoy incense and garlands, not enjoy evil friends, not be born into a low caste, and have a good appearance, dress, and ornaments.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realms of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha rnams kyi gnas glu'i sgra la shin tu dga' zhing mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha rnams kyi gnas glu'i sgra la shin tu dga' zhing mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have a realm called Delighting in Song and Attachment to Song.

original: sa der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: sa der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: he will examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i phyir sems dge ba las dge ba sems dri ma dang bral zhing gsal ba /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i phyir sems dge ba las dge ba sems dri ma dang bral zhing gsal ba /
translated: He will then notice that some people, with a virtuous mind that benefits both themselves and others, have a virtuous and clear mind free from stains.

original: lus dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' dge ba /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' dge ba /
translated: They engage in virtuous physical and verbal actions.

original: las kyi mtha' spyad pa dge zhing 'dod pa /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' spyad pa dge zhing 'dod pa /
translated: They engage in virtuous actions and are fond of them.

original: gtan du phan par 'dod pa //
analyzed: gtan du phan par 'dod pa //
translated: They wish for lasting benefit.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid can las dang / 'bras bu la dad pa /
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid can las dang / 'bras bu la dad pa /
translated: They are compassionate and have faith in actions and their effects.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi @294a *//🔽mtha' dang / tshul khrims kyi yon tan gnyis la rab tu zhugs pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi @294a *// mtha' dang / tshul khrims kyi yon tan gnyis la rab tu zhugs pa /
translated: and right livelihood.

original: lkog ma yin par byed pa /
analyzed: lkog ma yin par byed pa /
translated: They are not secretive.

original: sems ma g-yengs pa /
analyzed: sems ma g-yengs pa /
translated: They are not distracted in mind.

original: spyod pa ma g-yengs pa /
analyzed: spyod pa ma g-yengs pa /
translated: They are not distracted in conduct.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa /🔽mar 'dzin pa /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa / mar 'dzin pa /
translated: They are not of the nature of sinful friends.🔽They are respectful to their mothers.

original: phar 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phar 'dzin pa /
translated: They are respectful to their fathers.

original: dge sbyong du 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong du 'dzin pa /
translated: They are respectful to ascetics.🔽They are respectful to brahmins.

original: bram zer 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bram zer 'dzin pa /
translated: They are respectful to the elders of the family.🔽They are respectful to the Three Jewels.🔽They are respectful to the preceptor and the master.🔽They are respectful to the guru and the guru’s representative.🔽They are respectful to the saṅgha.

original: gang gi las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las dang / las kyi mjug dang gsum ste /
analyzed: gang gi las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las dang / las kyi mjug dang gsum ste /
translated: They are respectful to the elders of the saṅgha.🔽They are respectful to the teachers of the saṅgha.🔽They are respectful to the instructors of the saṅgha.

original: tshul khrims de dag kun kyang shin tu yongs su dag par byas /🔽tshul khrims kyis yon tan gnyis kyang bsrungs /
analyzed: tshul khrims de dag kun kyang shin tu yongs su dag par byas / tshul khrims kyis yon tan gnyis kyang bsrungs /
translated: They are respectful to the expounders of the Dharma.🔽They are respectful to the upholders of the vinaya.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the teachings.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the texts on discipline.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the Abhidharma.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa'ang rnam par spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa'ang rnam par spangs pa yin no //
translated: They are respectful to the masters of the vinaya.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the sūtras.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the bodhisattva canon.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the commentaries.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the treatises.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantras.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the commentaries on the tantras.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric canon.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric commentaries.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric treatises.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric rituals.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric initiations.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric empowerments.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric vows.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric pledges.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric conduct.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric view.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric meditation.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric activity.🔽They are respectful to the masters of the tantric results.

original: srog gcod pa shin tu bsrungs pa rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa shin tu bsrungs pa rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: They are respectful to the masters of the tantric stages.🔽They are respectful to the masters

original: 'di la nas dang / gro dang / 'bras s'a lu rnams kyi nang na sems can srin bu phra mo skyes pa dag rang thag la mi 'thag la /
analyzed: 'di la nas dang / gro dang / 'bras s'a lu rnams kyi nang na sems can srin bu phra mo skyes pa dag rang thag la mi 'thag la /
translated: In this regard, they do not sell barley, wheat, or rice that contains small insects.

original: de ltar srog chags de dag shin tu bsrung ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ltar srog chags de dag shin tu bsrung ba'i phyir ram /
translated: They do not sell barley or wheat because they are very careful to protect those living beings.

original: ma byin par len pas 'jigs pa'i phyir nas dang / gro dag kyang 'tshong bar mi byed /🔽ba lang dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dag la khur bkal bas rgyab snad pa dang / de dag la srin bu byung ba rnams chu'am /
analyzed: ma byin par len pas 'jigs pa'i phyir nas dang / gro dag kyang 'tshong bar mi byed / ba lang dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dag la khur bkal bas rgyab snad pa dang / de dag la srin bu byung ba rnams chu'am /
translated: Or they do not sell them because they are afraid of stealing.

original: rtsab mos 'khru zhing srin bu mi shi ba'i cho ga'ang byed de /
analyzed: rtsab mos 'khru zhing srin bu mi shi ba'i cho ga'ang byed de /
translated: They wash the sores of cows, horses, camels, and donkeys with water or grass, and they perform rituals to prevent the insects from dying.

original: 'di ltar bya sgro rnams kyis blangs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya sgro rnams kyis blangs nas /
translated: They pick the insects up with feathers

original: sha nyams pa gzhan la srin bu de dag 'jog par byed /
analyzed: sha nyams pa gzhan la srin bu de dag 'jog par byed /
translated: and place them on other, less damaged parts of the body.

original: chos ma yin pa'i 'jigs pas 'di ltar ba lang @294b dang; rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dag la gnod par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i 'jigs pas 'di ltar ba lang @294b dang; rta dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu dag la gnod par ma gyur cig /
translated: They think, ‘May cows, horses, camels, and donkeys not be harmed.

original: srin bur gyur pa'i srin bu rnams kyang 'chi bar ma gyur cig ces de ltar gnyis ka'i srog srung bar byed /
analyzed: srin bur gyur pa'i srin bu rnams kyang 'chi bar ma gyur cig ces de ltar gnyis ka'i srog srung bar byed /
translated: May the worms that are born as worms not die!’ In this way, they protect the lives of both.

original: srog chags phre'u dang / grog sbur la sogs pa'ang shin tu srung bar byed /
analyzed: srog chags phre'u dang / grog sbur la sogs pa'ang shin tu srung bar byed /
translated: They also protect the lives of ants, termites, and so forth.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du kun la phan par 'dod pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du kun la phan par 'dod pa /
translated: They wish to benefit everyone in every respect.

original: nyin mo dang / mtshan mo yid la bag med par mi byed; srog chags rnams la yid kyis kyang 'khu bar mi byed /
analyzed: nyin mo dang / mtshan mo yid la bag med par mi byed; srog chags rnams la yid kyis kyang 'khu bar mi byed /
translated: They are not careless during the day or at night, and they do not harm any living being even in their minds.

original: sems can pha rol la dang po nas sems can gyi 'du shes bskyed de /
analyzed: sems can pha rol la dang po nas sems can gyi 'du shes bskyed de /
translated: From the very beginning, they develop the perception of all beings as sentient beings.

original: srog chags phre'u dang / grog sbur la sogs pa de dag kun tu srung bar byed cing gnas skabs thams cad du dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: srog chags phre'u dang / grog sbur la sogs pa de dag kun tu srung bar byed cing gnas skabs thams cad du dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa yin te /
translated: They protect the lives of ants, termites, and so forth, and in all situations they engage in virtuous actions.

original: de dag ni srog gcod pa srung ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag ni srog gcod pa srung ba yin zhing /
translated: They protect against killing.

original: de dag ni srog gcod pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni srog gcod pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: They have given up killing.

original: ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: “What is it to give up stealing?

original: rnam pa ni du yod ce na /🔽'di la de ltar dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa de sems can sbal ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa ni du yod ce na / 'di la de ltar dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa de sems can sbal ba'am /
translated: What are the aspects of this?🔽In this case, when someone practices virtue in this way, they will free those sentient beings who have been caught by frogs,

original: sre mo'am / khyi 'am; wa bzung ba de dag zas gzhan gyis thar bar byed do //
analyzed: sre mo'am / khyi 'am; wa bzung ba de dag zas gzhan gyis thar bar byed do //
translated: monkeys, dogs, or jackals.

original: thar bar byas nas kyang sha rjen za ba de dag la zas de dag sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: thar bar byas nas kyang sha rjen za ba de dag la zas de dag sbyin par byed do //
translated: Having freed them, they will give food to those who eat raw meat.

original: bkres pa de dag kyang de dag nyid za bar byed de /
analyzed: bkres pa de dag kyang de dag nyid za bar byed de /
translated: Those who are hungry will eat that food.

original: de ltar srog chags de dag kyang shin tu bsrungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar srog chags de dag kyang shin tu bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, those beings will be well protected.

original: de ni lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: They will be reborn among the gods.

original: de ltar ma byin par len pas ni lha rnams kyi nang nas shi @295a *//
analyzed: de ltar ma byin par len pas ni lha rnams kyi nang nas shi @295a *//
translated: In this way, through stealing, one will die among the gods

original: nas dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nas dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: and be reborn among the animals.

original: rnam pa de dag ni ma byin par len pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ni ma byin par len pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: These are the aspects of giving up stealing.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang spangs la gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jog par byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang spangs la gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jog par byed /
translated: One should give up stealing oneself and establish others on the path of virtue.

original: dge ba la ma zhugs pa'ang dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jog par byed /
analyzed: dge ba la ma zhugs pa'ang dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jog par byed /
translated: He or she also establishes those who are not engaged in virtue in the path of virtue.🔽He or she also encourages those who are engaged in virtue to continue to do so.

original: zhugs pa'ang yang dang / yang du gzengs bstod par byed; las kyi 'bras bu nye bar ston par byed /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de gus pa chen pos gzims cha'i gdan gyi gzhi de la phyag 'tshal bar byed do //

analyzed: bag yod pa yis bde 'gyur la //

analyzed: de nas @306b lha rnams kyang brgya byin de mthong nas /

analyzed: gnas 'dir dong zhing sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dbyangs sna tshogs nye bar len la /

translated: As long as the effects of their completed and accumulated actions have not been exhausted, they will continue to enjoy each other’s company.🔽They will play and frolic.🔽

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: They will enjoy each other’s company, play, and indulge in pleasures as long as their completed and accumulated acts that bring desirable, attractive, and delightful effects have not been exhausted.

translated: “When that happens, they will fall and, in accordance with their karmic actions, be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals in cyclic existence.

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par yul shin tu rgyas pa /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par yul shin tu rgyas pa /
translated: “Those who have closed the doors to the lower realms will, if they are born with the general lot in life of a human, be born in a country that is vast

analyzed: 'bab chu dang / chu bo dang / lteng ka rab tu mang ba phun sum tshogs pa /

analyzed: rtag tu legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' rnams su shin tu rgyas par 'gyur te /

original: mchog tu rgya che ba'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: mchog tu rgya che ba'i rgyal po'am /

analyzed: blon po chen po skye bo kun dga' ba /

analyzed: blo gros rgya che zhing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la mngon par dga' la rtag tu dge ba byed par mngon par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: He will have vast intelligence, delight in generosity and discipline, and always engage in virtue.

analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi sa la rtog par @307b byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha rnams kyi gnas gzi brjid 'byor ba zhes bya ba /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realms of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas; des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see a realm of the gods known as Splendor of Wealth.🔽What are the karmic actions by which beings are born there?

original: 'di ltar skyes bu dam pa dge ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu dam pa dge ba dang ldan pa /

original: skyes bu dam pa rtag tu bag yod pa dang ldan par gyur pa /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rtag tu bag yod pa dang ldan par gyur pa /

analyzed: sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa /

original: las kyi 'bras bu la dad pa /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu la dad pa /

analyzed: shing sha pa skye ba'i nang ngam; aa mra skye ba'i nang ngam /

analyzed: n'a ni ke ra skye ba'i nang na sgo nga yod pa dag bya'am / sprul dag gis bzung na /

analyzed: de dag gzhan la phan par zhugs pa snying rjes brlan pa'i yid kyis thar par byed pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar srog chags dag thar par byed pa yin no //

original: ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la shing pa la sha'i tshal du pa la sha'i lo ma'ang len par mi byed la /

original: gzhan gyis blangs par shes nas kyang zlog par byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyis blangs par shes nas kyang zlog par byed /

analyzed: lam du zhugs pa na 'bra gos la lhung ba'ang len par mi byed la /
translated: Even if one sees fallen fruit on the road, one should not take it.

original: gzhan gyis blangs par shes nas kyang zlog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis blangs par shes nas kyang zlog par byed pa yin te /
translated: and even if he knows that someone else has taken it, he will not take it back.

original: de ltar ma byin par len pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma byin par len pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: This is how he gives up stealing.

original: dge ba spyod pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba spyod pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: “What is it like to practice virtue?

original: 'di la spyin pa la mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: 'di la spyin pa la mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Here, he delights in giving.

original: lo nyes byung ba'i tshe @308a *//
analyzed: lo nyes byung ba'i tshe @308a *//
translated: When there is a famine,

original: dge sbyong dag la lo lnga pa'i gzhal ba phyed sbyin nam /
analyzed: dge sbyong dag la lo lnga pa'i gzhal ba phyed sbyin nam /
translated: he gives to the ascetics half of the value of five years’ worth of food.

original: sdom pa blangs pa'i nad pa dag la zas sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: sdom pa blangs pa'i nad pa dag la zas sbyin par byed cing /
translated: He gives food to the sick who have taken vows.🔽He establishes others in that,

original: gzhan dag kyang de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed; dga' bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed; dga' bar byed /
translated: he delights them,

original: rab tu dga' bar byed /
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar byed /
translated: he delights them greatly,

original: las kyi 'bras bu ston par byed /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu ston par byed /
translated: he teaches the results of actions,

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rtag par rjes su dran par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rtag par rjes su dran par byed /

analyzed: pha ma'am / dge bsnyen sdom pa blangs pa phal pa la'ang na ba'i gsos sman gyi rkyen gyi yo byad sbyin par byed /

original: gzhan dag kyang de nyid la de ltar rab tu 'jog par byed /

analyzed: de zad nas ltung bar 'gyur te /

translated: Having fallen, they will be born among hell beings, starving spirits, and animals in accordance with their karmic actions. If they are born with the general lot in life of humans, in accordance with their causal actions they will be extremely happy.

analyzed: nor mang ba dang / mchog tu rgya che ba la dga' ba dang / dam pa'i @311a *//
translated: They will be wealthy, enjoy the most extensive pleasures, and be

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas zla ba'i gnas ltar rgyu ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gi skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /

translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see the realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three known as Moving Like the Moon.🔽Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags pa na dge ba'i las kyi mtha' dpyod pa / sems dri ma dang bral ba /

translated: “ ‘Those who have trained their minds well and created faultless images of the Buddha will also create images of the Blessed One using gold,🔽silver, copper,

analyzed: bir ram / rab tu gsal bar byed pas sdug par byed cing sku gzugs dri ma dang bral ba mchog tu sdug pa de dag mthong nas sbyin bdag de shin tu snying dga' la sems kyis kyang yang dang / yang du byed na /
translated: With a pure mind, they will create beautiful images that are free from stains and are extremely delightful. When they see such images, the benefactors will be overjoyed and will repeatedly think,

analyzed: de sems kyi zhing yon tan bzang po dang; sems kyi rgyu sems bsgoms pas dge ba spyod pa bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: “If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, be happy from the moment of their birth.

original: blon po chen por skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: blon po chen por skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: stan khra po rnam pa sna tshogs legs par bting ba /
translated: Various colorful cushions are well arranged.

original: rin po che'i gos sna tshogs kyis mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i gos sna tshogs kyis mdzes par byas pa /
translated: They are beautified with various precious fabrics.

original: 'dug khri de dag kyang sdug par byas shing rkang pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mdzes par byas pa'i 'dug khri'i rkang pa de la nye bar brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'dug khri de dag kyang sdug par byas shing rkang pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mdzes par byas pa'i 'dug khri'i rkang pa de la nye bar brgyan pa /
translated: Those seats are also beautiful, and their legs are adorned with various types of ornaments.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rdo rje dang / aanda rnyil dang / shel dang / gser dang / dngul gyis rnam par brgyan pa dag ma thong ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje dang / aanda rnyil dang / shel dang / gser dang / dngul gyis rnam par brgyan pa dag ma thong ngo //
translated: They are adorned with diamonds, sapphires, crystals, gold, and silver.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: Then,

original: brgya byin sngon du 'gro ba'i lha shing s'a la zung gi nang du zhugs pa rnams ri'i rtse mo kun nas mthong na yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: brgya byin sngon du 'gro ba'i lha shing s'a la zung gi nang du zhugs pa rnams ri'i rtse mo kun nas mthong na yid du 'ong ba /
translated: the gods, led by Śakra, enter the pair of śāla trees and see the peak of the mountain, which is delightful in every way.

original: bya sna tshogs 'bum snyed kyis yongs su bskor cing skad 'byin pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: bya sna tshogs 'bum snyed kyis yongs su bskor cing skad 'byin pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: They see hundreds of thousands of various birds singing.

original: de nas lha rnams la brgya byin gyis 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams la brgya byin gyis 'di skad smras so //
translated: Then Śakra says to the gods,

original: shing s'a la zung gi nang na nyams dga' ba 'di la khyed cag ltos /
analyzed: shing s'a la zung gi nang na nyams dga' ba 'di la khyed cag ltos /
translated: ‘Look at the delightful pair of śāla trees.🔽’

original: lha'i rgyal pos de skad smras pa dang / lha rnams @321b kyis 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal pos de skad smras pa dang / lha rnams @321b kyis 'di skad smras so //
translated: When the king of the gods says this, the gods reply,

original: brgya byin / ji lta ba bzhin mthong lags so //
analyzed: brgya byin / ji lta ba bzhin mthong lags so //
translated: ‘Śakra, we see it just as it is.’

original: de nas lha'i 'khor de na 'di ltar lha bag med pas yid shin tu lhag par dbang du byas pa gang yin pa de dag mthong ba dang / de dag bkar nas las kyi 'bras bu shin tu bstan pa'i phyir las kyi me long gi khang ba zhes bya ba der 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de nas lha'i 'khor de na 'di ltar lha bag med pas yid shin tu lhag par dbang du byas pa gang yin pa de dag mthong ba dang / de dag bkar nas las kyi 'bras bu shin tu bstan pa'i phyir las kyi me long gi khang ba zhes bya ba der 'jug par byed do //
translated: Then, when he sees that the divine retinue is completely under the control of heedless minds, he leads them to the so-called House of the Mirror of Karma in order to teach them the results of their actions.

original: de nas las kyi me long gi khang pa der zhugs nas brgya byin des bee d'urya'i rtsig ngos shin tu dri ma med pa /
analyzed: de nas las kyi me long gi khang pa der zhugs nas brgya byin des bee d'urya'i rtsig ngos shin tu dri ma med pa /
translated: When they have entered the House of the Mirror of Karma, Śakra shows them the extremely pure walls of beryl.

original: me long g-ya' med pa ltar kun nas gsal ba de dag ston par byed do //
analyzed: me long g-ya' med pa ltar kun nas gsal ba de dag ston par byed do //
translated: They are as clear as a polished mirror.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: “ ‘Furthermore,

original: brgya byin des lha rnams la ston par byed de /
analyzed: brgya byin des lha rnams la ston par byed de /
translated: Śakra shows the gods

original: lha dag / las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa rtsig ngos me long lta bu la bris pa sna tshogs snang ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: lha dag / las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa rtsig ngos me long lta bu la bris pa sna tshogs snang ba 'di yin te /
translated: the various images of the results of karmic actions that appear on the mirror-like walls.

original: gang dang / gang gis las gang byas pa dang / rnam pa gang dang / gus pa gang gis /
analyzed: gang dang / gang gis las gang byas pa dang / rnam pa gang dang / gus pa gang gis /
translated: “ ‘Whatever actions are performed, in whatever way, and with whatever devotion,

original: gang gi tshe zhing gang la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhing gang la /
translated: “ ‘Look at the fields in which you gave,

original: dngos po gang byin pa /
analyzed: dngos po gang byin pa /
translated: the things you gave,🔽how you gave them,🔽the faith with which you gave,🔽the time at which you gave,🔽how you dedicated the merit,

original: ji ltar byin pa dang / dad pa gang gis sbyin pa dang / dus gang gis tshe byin pa de ltar yongs su bsngos ba dang / gang gi tshe yongs su bsngos pa dang / 'bras bu gang du skye bar yongs su bsngos pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar byin pa dang / dad pa gang gis sbyin pa dang / dus gang gis tshe byin pa de ltar yongs su bsngos ba dang / gang gi tshe yongs su bsngos pa dang / 'bras bu gang du skye bar yongs su bsngos pa dang /
translated: the fruit of your generosity that you dedicated to rebirth in a certain place,

original: rnam pa gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu snang ba de dag la khyed cag ltos /🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu snang ba de dag la khyed cag ltos / de nas gzhan yang /
translated: and the way in which you dedicated the fruit of your generosity.🔽’

original: brgya byin des lha de dag la rab tu ston par byed de /
analyzed: brgya byin des lha de dag la rab tu ston par byed de /
translated: “ ‘Then Śakra will teach the gods further:

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims shin tu bsgoms pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims shin tu bsgoms pa /
translated: “You have cultivated discipline well.

original: 'gro ba thams cad pha ma lta bur gyur pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad pha ma lta bur gyur pa /
translated: You have regarded all beings as your parents.

original: slu ba med pa /🔽rnam par smin @322a *//
analyzed: slu ba med pa / rnam par smin @322a *//
translated: You have been undeceiving.🔽The ripening

original: pa mchog tu nyams dga' ba /
analyzed: pa mchog tu nyams dga' ba /
translated: of your discipline is delightful.

original: mtsho ltar rnyog pa med pa /
analyzed: mtsho ltar rnyog pa med pa /
translated: Like a lake, it is free of turbidity.

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i sa bon gang gis /
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i sa bon gang gis /
translated: It is the seed for going to the higher realms.

original: gang gi tshe ji ltar gang zhig gang rnams la rnam pa gang gis tshul khrims rnam pa bdun srung ba de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji ltar gang zhig gang rnams la rnam pa gang gis tshul khrims rnam pa bdun srung ba de /
translated: When, in whatever way, and to whatever extent a person protects the seven aspects of ethical discipline,

original: de'i tshe rnam pa des gnas skabs der skyes pa de'i tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de lha dang / mi rnams kyi nang du smin pa la khyed cag ltos /🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa des gnas skabs der skyes pa de'i tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de lha dang / mi rnams kyi nang du smin pa la khyed cag ltos / de nas gzhan yang /
translated: then at that time, in that situation, and in that way, you should see how the results of that person’s discipline will ripen among gods and humans.

original: brgya byin des lha de dag nyid la der las kyi me long nyid rab tu ston par byed de /
analyzed: brgya byin des lha de dag nyid la der las kyi me long nyid rab tu ston par byed de /
translated: “ ‘Moreover, Śakra will show the gods the mirror of karmic actions.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag kun ni las kyi 'bras bu'i tshogs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag kun ni las kyi 'bras bu'i tshogs yin te /
translated: “ ‘All of this is the collection of the results of karmic actions.

original: ye shes kyi sgron ma'i skyes bu gang gis gang gi tshe 'di ltar ye shes la goms shing /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgron ma'i skyes bu gang gis gang gi tshe 'di ltar ye shes la goms shing /
translated: You should see how the person who is the lamp of wisdom, at whatever time he has become accustomed to wisdom,

original: yang dag pa'i lta bar gyur pa ye shes de'i tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'bras bu la khyed cag ltos /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bar gyur pa ye shes de'i tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'bras bu la khyed cag ltos /
translated: and has thus developed the correct view, will experience the results of that wisdom, whether inferior, middling, or superior, whether contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: “ ‘Moreover, Śakra will show the gods the mirror of karmic actions.

original: brgya byin des lha de dag nyid la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes rnam pa dgu'i gnas skabs rab tu ston par byed de /
analyzed: brgya byin des lha de dag nyid la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes rnam pa dgu'i gnas skabs rab tu ston par byed de /
translated: Śakra will then teach the gods about generosity, discipline, and wisdom in nine contexts.

original: sbyin pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog gis mtho ris rnams su 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog gis mtho ris rnams su 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “ ‘The gods, the gods! The results of generosity, whether inferior, middling, or superior, will ripen in the higher realms.

original: de la sems bsgoms shing /
analyzed: de la sems bsgoms shing /
translated: “ ‘When the mind is trained,

original: zhing yon tan dang ldan la slu ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan yang dngos po phun sum tshogs pa ma yin na 'bras bu de nyid chung la /
analyzed: zhing yon tan dang ldan la slu ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan yang dngos po phun sum tshogs pa ma yin na 'bras bu de nyid chung la /
translated: and the field is endowed with qualities and is not deceptive, but the object is not perfect, the result will be small.

original: 'bras bu yi dvags mthu bo cher 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yi dvags mthu bo cher 'gyur te /
translated: If the result is that of a powerful hungry ghost,

original: dud 'gro zhig na'ang 'bras bu bde ba 'thob @322b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro zhig na'ang 'bras bu bde ba 'thob @322b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then even as an animal one will obtain a happy result.

original: lha dag / las kyi me long 'di nyid kyi nang na 'bras bu gzugs brnyan snang ba sbyin pa 'bring 'di la ltos /
analyzed: lha dag / las kyi me long 'di nyid kyi nang na 'bras bu gzugs brnyan snang ba sbyin pa 'bring 'di la ltos /
translated: Gods, look at the reflection of the result of middling generosity in this very mirror of karmic actions.

original: las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs bris pa'i rtsig ngos la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'bring ni /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs bris pa'i rtsig ngos la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'bring ni /
translated: “ ‘On the wall that depicts the various results of karmic actions, the results of middling generosity are depicted as follows.

original: sems ma bsgoms shing dngos po yon tan dang yang mi ldan la /
analyzed: sems ma bsgoms shing dngos po yon tan dang yang mi ldan la /
translated: He has not cultivated his mind and does not possess any good qualities.🔽

original: zhing yon tan dang ldan pa kho na la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni /🔽nub kyi ba lang spyod dam /
analyzed: zhing yon tan dang ldan pa kho na la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni / nub kyi ba lang spyod dam /
translated: The result of generosity to a field that is endowed with qualities, but whose mind is not trained and whose qualities are not fully developed,🔽will be experienced as a human in Godaniya in the west,

original: shar gyi lus 'phags gling gi mi rnams kyi nang ngam /🔽dud 'gro 'am /
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags gling gi mi rnams kyi nang ngam / dud 'gro 'am /
translated: or in Videha in the east,🔽or as an animal,

original: gnod sbyin nam /🔽lha ma yin rnams kyi nang du 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnod sbyin nam / lha ma yin rnams kyi nang du 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: or as a yakṣa,🔽or as an asura.

original: 'bras bu 'bring po thob pa de'ang de ltar me long lta bur lha de dag nyid kyi mngon sum du snang ngo //🔽de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'bring po thob pa de'ang de ltar me long lta bur lha de dag nyid kyi mngon sum du snang ngo // de nas gzhan yang /
translated: The results of middling generosity will be experienced in the presence of the gods themselves, as if in a mirror.

original: brgya byin gyis las kyi me long de nyid kyi nang na gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bor gyur pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis las kyi me long de nyid kyi nang na gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bor gyur pa /
translated: “ ‘Furthermore, Śakra will show the gods the reflections in the mirror of karmic actions.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum po 'dis kyang rab tu ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum po 'dis kyang rab tu ston par byed do //
translated: He will teach them about the three kinds of results of generosity.

original: gzhan yang / lha khyed cag tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog la ltos shig /
analyzed: gzhan yang / lha khyed cag tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog la ltos shig /
translated: He will also say, “Gods, look at the inferior, the middling, and the superior.

original: de la tha ma ni rnam pa gzhan gyis mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la tha ma ni rnam pa gzhan gyis mi 'gyur te /
translated: The last is not changed by other aspects.

original: 'di ltar sems ma bsgoms la zhing phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems ma bsgoms la zhing phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the field is excellent, but the mind is not cultivated.

original: de la sems ma bsgoms pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems ma bsgoms pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the mind is not cultivated?

original: sbyin bdag gang srog chags la shin tu phan pa byas shing /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gang srog chags la shin tu phan pa byas shing /
translated: A donor who has greatly benefited living beings,

original: zhing dang / dngos po rnyed kyang sems dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhing dang / dngos po rnyed kyang sems dad pa ma yin te /
translated: and has obtained a field and an object, but whose mind is not faithful,🔽and who does not respectfully rise up, bow down, and so forth with the body.

original: lus kyis mngon par ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa gus par mi byed pa 'di ni zhing yon tan dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: lus kyis mngon par ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa gus par mi byed pa 'di ni zhing yon tan dang ldan zhing /
translated: This is a field endowed with good qualities,

original: dngos po yon tan dang ldan pa yin @323a *//
analyzed: dngos po yon tan dang ldan pa yin @323a *//
translated: and an object endowed with good qualities,

original: yang sems yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang sems yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: but the mind is not endowed with good qualities.

original: sbyin pa slu ba med pa byas pas /🔽ri brags sam /
analyzed: sbyin pa slu ba med pa byas pas / ri brags sam /
translated: By giving without deception,🔽one becomes a king of a small country,

original: kla klo rnams kyi rgyal po'am /
analyzed: kla klo rnams kyi rgyal po'am /
translated: or a king of barbarians,🔽or a great minister.🔽Look at the ground of the Karma Mirror!

original: blon po chen por 'gyur ba las kyi me long gi sa gzhi nyid la khyed cag ltos shig ces de ltar brgya byin de lha rnams la rab tu ston par byed do //
analyzed: blon po chen por 'gyur ba las kyi me long gi sa gzhi nyid la khyed cag ltos shig ces de ltar brgya byin de lha rnams la rab tu ston par byed do //
translated: In this way, Śakra teaches the gods.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa'i mchog 'di ni sems dang ldan pa dang / zhing yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dngos po yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems bsgoms pa yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa'i mchog 'di ni sems dang ldan pa dang / zhing yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dngos po yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems bsgoms pa yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this supreme generosity is endowed with a mind, a field of excellent qualities, an object of excellent qualities, and a mind of excellent qualities.

original: de la zhing ngam pa ni /
analyzed: de la zhing ngam pa ni /
translated: The field of excellent qualities is

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
translated: the Buddha, etc.

original: dngos po ni /
analyzed: dngos po ni /
translated: The object of excellent qualities is

original: bza' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: food, etc.

original: sems bsgoms pa ni /
analyzed: sems bsgoms pa ni /
translated: The mind of excellent qualities is

original: sems dang ba dang gus pa yin te sbyin pa 'bras bu chen po 'di ni lha dang / mi rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang ba dang gus pa yin te sbyin pa 'bras bu chen po 'di ni lha dang / mi rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a pure and respectful mind. This generosity of great fruit will be reborn among gods and humans.

original: de la lha rnams kyi nang du ni lha chen por 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la lha rnams kyi nang du ni lha chen por 'gyur la /
translated: Among the gods, one will become a great god.

original: mi rnams kyi nang du ni gling bzhi pa 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul che ba /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du ni gling bzhi pa 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rdzu 'phrul che ba /
translated: Among humans, one will become a universal monarch of the four continents, of great magical power,

original: rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the seven treasures,

original: nye ba'i rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nye ba'i rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the seven minor treasures,

original: chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su lta ba /
analyzed: chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su lta ba /
translated: righteous, and following the Dharma.

analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad spyad nas de la rten te tshul khrims spyod cing ye shes kyang shes par byed do //
translated: Having enjoyed all the perfections, one practices discipline in dependence on them and also generates wisdom.

original: de mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug par byed de /
translated: One enters the city of nirvāṇa.

original: sbyin pa 'di ni bla na med cing sbyin pa 'di nyid bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'di ni bla na med cing sbyin pa 'di nyid bla na med pa yin no //
translated: This generosity is unsurpassed and this generosity alone is unsurpassed.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu @323b bee d'urya shin tu dri ma med pa'i las kyi rtsig ngos la snang ba 'di brgya byin des lha de dag nyid la rab tu ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu @323b bee d'urya shin tu dri ma med pa'i las kyi rtsig ngos la snang ba 'di brgya byin des lha de dag nyid la rab tu ston par byed de /
translated: Moreover, Śakra shows the gods the reflection of the result of generosity on the wall of the palace of the most pure beryl.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gzhan rnam pa gsum gyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gzugs brnyan snang ba 'di la ltos /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gzhan rnam pa gsum gyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gzugs brnyan snang ba 'di la ltos /
translated: “Look at the reflection of the result of generosity in these three other ways.”

original: de nas yang brgya byin des lha dag la rab tu ston par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang brgya byin des lha dag la rab tu ston par byed de /
translated: Then Śakra shows the gods

original: 'di ltar zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: the generosity of material things, the generosity of fearlessness, and the generosity of the Dharma.

original: de la zang zing sbyin pas ni snga ma bzhin longs spyod chen por 'gyur /
analyzed: de la zang zing sbyin pas ni snga ma bzhin longs spyod chen por 'gyur /
translated: By giving material things, one becomes as before, with great wealth.

original: mi 'jigs pa byin pas ni yul bzang po'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa byin pas ni yul bzang po'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
translated: By giving fearlessness, one becomes a king of a good country,

original: mtshon cha dang / lo nyes pa dang / dkon pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: mtshon cha dang / lo nyes pa dang / dkon pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from the fear of weapons, famine, and scarcity,

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from the fear of untimely death,

original: 'gran zla'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'gran zla'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from the fear of rivals,

original: nad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: nad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from the fear of disease,

original: me'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: me'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from the fear of fire,

original: chu'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba /🔽'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral bar rgyal po'am /
analyzed: chu'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral bar rgyal po'am /
translated: free from the fear of water,

original: blon po chen po yun ring du gnas par byed do //
analyzed: blon po chen po yun ring du gnas par byed do //
translated: free from the fear of death, and one becomes a king or a great minister who lives for a long time.🔽This is the result of giving fearlessness.

original: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa byin pa'i 'bras bu las kyi me long gi nang du sbyin pa 'bring po 'di ji lta ba bzhin snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa byin pa'i 'bras bu las kyi me long gi nang du sbyin pa 'bring po 'di ji lta ba bzhin snang ngo //
translated: The medium giving appears in the mirror of karma.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa rnams kyi nang na sbyin pa mchog las kyi me long gi rtsig ngos la snang ba /
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa rnams kyi nang na sbyin pa mchog las kyi me long gi rtsig ngos la snang ba /
translated: Moreover, the supreme giving among all the givings appears on the wall of the mirror of karma.

original: sbyin pa 'di dag gi nang na dam pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa 'di dag gi nang na dam pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The best of these gifts is🔽the gift of Dharma.

original: 'khor ba tthams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i sa bon chos sbyin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba tthams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i sa bon chos sbyin pa yin te /
translated: The gift of Dharma is the seed of definite release from all cyclic existence.

original: sbyin pa mchog 'di sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni byang chub gsum smin par 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu snang ste nye bar 'tsho ba'i rgyu dang / grags pa'i rgyu dang / 'gran zla gzhan zil @324a *//
analyzed: sbyin pa mchog 'di sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni byang chub gsum smin par 'gyur ro // gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu snang ste nye bar 'tsho ba'i rgyu dang / grags pa'i rgyu dang / 'gran zla gzhan zil @324a *//
translated: The fruit of this best gift ripens as the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: gyis gnon pa'i rgyu dang / gzhan la phan gdags pa'i rgyu kho na yin no //
analyzed: gyis gnon pa'i rgyu dang / gzhan la phan gdags pa'i rgyu kho na yin no //
translated: Moreover, the fruit of the gift of Dharma is seen to be the cause of livelihood, the cause of fame, the cause of surpassing others, and the cause of benefiting others.

original: de la nye bar 'tsho ba'i rgyu ni gang gzhan la phan gdags par zhugs pas ma yin gyi nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du chos ston par byed pa 'di ni tha ma yin te /
analyzed: de la nye bar 'tsho ba'i rgyu ni gang gzhan la phan gdags par zhugs pas ma yin gyi nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du chos ston par byed pa 'di ni tha ma yin te /
translated: Among these, the cause of livelihood is the lowest, for one teaches the Dharma not in order to benefit others, but in order to make a living.

original: 'di ltar gzhan la phan gdags par sems bsgoms pa'i snying gis 'chab par mi byed pa yin la nor rdzas kho na'i phyir 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan la phan gdags par sems bsgoms pa'i snying gis 'chab par mi byed pa yin la nor rdzas kho na'i phyir 'chad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, with a heart that cultivates the intention to benefit others, he does not conceal anything.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag la 'chad pa de ltar sgrub pa mi byed pa 'di ni sbyin pa tha ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag la 'chad pa de ltar sgrub pa mi byed pa 'di ni sbyin pa tha ma yin no //
translated: But if he teaches only for the sake of wealth, this is the lowest form of generosity.

original: de lta bas na nor rdzas thob pa gang yin pa de dag chang gis zad par byed dam /
analyzed: de lta bas na nor rdzas thob pa gang yin pa de dag chang gis zad par byed dam /
translated: Therefore, whatever wealth he obtains, he squanders it on alcohol or on women.

original: bud med dang lhan cig zad par byed pa tshul khrims rnam par spangs pa 'di ni gar mkhan lta bu'i chos nyid kho nar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig zad par byed pa tshul khrims rnam par spangs pa 'di ni gar mkhan lta bu'i chos nyid kho nar zhugs pa yin te /
translated: He is a renunciant who has abandoned morality, and he is only engaged in the nature of a dancer.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa 'di ni 'bras bu chung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa 'di ni 'bras bu chung ba yin no //
translated: This is the lowest form of the gift of the Dharma.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa gar skye zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa gar skye zhe na /
translated: Where is the ripened result of this gift of the Dharma?

original: de las kyi me long la mthong ste /
analyzed: de las kyi me long la mthong ste /
translated: It is seen in the mirror of karma.

original: lha rnams kyi nang du bya mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi nang du bya mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur la /
translated: He will be born among the gods as a bird with a clever nature.

original: de bzhin du tshigs su bcad pa ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshigs su bcad pa ston par 'gyur te /
translated: And he will recite these verses:

original: 'di ni chos sbyin pa tha ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos sbyin pa tha ma yin no //
translated: This is the lowest form of generosity with the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa 'phring ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa 'phring ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is middling generosity with the Dharma?

original: grags pa 'dod pa'i phyir chos 'chad pa'am /
analyzed: grags pa 'dod pa'i phyir chos 'chad pa'am /
translated: Generosity with the Dharma is taught out of desire for fame or

original: chos smra ba gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir zhe sdang gi tshul gyis 'chad pa de'i chos kyi sbyin pa ni 'bras bu chung ba yin la /🔽de'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pas ni lha'am /
analyzed: chos smra ba gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir zhe sdang gi tshul gyis 'chad pa de'i chos kyi sbyin pa ni 'bras bu chung ba yin la / de'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pas ni lha'am /
translated: out of a hostile attitude to surpass other Dharma teachers. The generosity with the Dharma of such a person has a small result.🔽The result of that generosity with the Dharma ripens among the middling gods or

original: mi 'bring po rnams kyi nang du @324b smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'bring po rnams kyi nang du @324b smin par 'gyur te /
translated: humans.

original: de ltar brgya byin des las kyi me long gi gnas dag tu lha rnams la ston par byed /
analyzed: de ltar brgya byin des las kyi me long gi gnas dag tu lha rnams la ston par byed /
translated: In this way, Śakra shows the gods the realm of the mirror of karma and

original: mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: mthong bar byed do //
translated: makes them see it.

original: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa mchog ni sems bsgoms pa skyon med pa blo gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ston pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa mchog ni sems bsgoms pa skyon med pa blo gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ston pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the highest generosity with the Dharma is teaching the Dharma in order to train the mind of one who has cultivated the mind free of faults.

original: 'tsho bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'tsho bar mi byed /
translated: One does not make a living from it.

original: log par lta ba gzhan dag kyang chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'jog par byed la 'tsho bar mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba gzhan dag kyang chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'jog par byed la 'tsho bar mi byed pa yin te /
translated: One also establishes others in the Dharma-Vinaya who have wrong views, but one does not make a living from it.

original: de ltar bdag dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa mthar mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos sbyin pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa mthar mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos sbyin pa mchog yin no //
translated: Thus, the supreme gift of the Dharma is the gift of nirvana, which is the ultimate benefit for oneself and others.

original: yang brgya byin des chos kyi sbyin pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam pa gzhan gyis lha rnams la ston par byed /
analyzed: yang brgya byin des chos kyi sbyin pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam pa gzhan gyis lha rnams la ston par byed /
translated: Śakra also shows the gods the other aspects of the results of the gift of the Dharma.

original: yang dag par 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag par 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains:

original: shes rab kyis ma grol ba ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ma grol ba ni tha ma yin no //
translated: The inferior gift of the Dharma is the gift of the Dharma that is not liberated by wisdom.

original: tshul khrims la zhugs pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims la zhugs pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The middling gift of the Dharma is the gift of the Dharma that is endowed with moral discipline but is not liberated by wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba ni mchog yin no //
translated: The supreme gift of the Dharma is the gift of the Dharma that is endowed with moral discipline and is liberated by wisdom.

original: de la shes rab tha ma ni de sbyin pa'i gtam dang yang dag par ldan pa shin tu khong du chud par chos ston pa ma yin la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de la shes rab tha ma ni de sbyin pa'i gtam dang yang dag par ldan pa shin tu khong du chud par chos ston pa ma yin la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ston pa yin te /
translated: The inferior gift of the Dharma is the gift of the Dharma that is not endowed with the discourse on generosity and is not a teaching that is well understood. It is only a teaching on the results of generosity.

original: de rgyu de dang / gzhi de la brten nas sbyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims dang / shes rab la'ang gnas so //
analyzed: de rgyu de dang / gzhi de la brten nas sbyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims dang / shes rab la'ang gnas so //
translated: On the basis of that cause and that reason, one abides in generosity and also abides in moral discipline and wisdom.

original: de dad pa 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'brang ba yin la /
analyzed: de dad pa 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'brang ba yin la /
translated: He is a follower of faith.

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba 'di chos sbyin pa tha ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba 'di chos sbyin pa tha ma yin te /
translated: The second is an arhat who has exhausted the defilements and is liberated from both aspects. This is the lowest form of generosity of the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam dang ldan pa 'di ni chos sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i gtam dang ldan pa 'di ni chos sbyin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this generosity of the Dharma is endowed with the discourse on generosity.

original: chos sbyin pa 'bring ni tshul khrims kyi gtam @325a *//
analyzed: chos sbyin pa 'bring ni tshul khrims kyi gtam @325a *//
translated: The medium generosity of the Dharma is endowed with the discourse on discipline.

original: dang rab tu ldan zhing sems yongs su bsgoms pas ston pa shes rab 'bring yin la /
analyzed: dang rab tu ldan zhing sems yongs su bsgoms pas ston pa shes rab 'bring yin la /
translated: It is taught by one who has fully cultivated the mind and has medium wisdom.

original: de'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni las kyi me long gi rtsig ngos kyi nang na snang ste /
analyzed: de'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni las kyi me long gi rtsig ngos kyi nang na snang ste /
translated: The ripening of the result of that action appears within the wall of the mirror of karma.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang ba dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang ba dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: Thus, a follower of wisdom becomes an arhat

original: shin tu myur bar zag pa zad par byed na rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu myur bar zag pa zad par byed na rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: or, if he quickly exhausts the defilements, he becomes a pratyekabuddha.

original: chos sbyin pa 'bring de'i rgyus las kyi rnam par smin pa las kyi me long gi nang na snang ngo //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa 'bring de'i rgyus las kyi rnam par smin pa las kyi me long gi nang na snang ngo //
translated: The medium generosity of the Dharma causes the ripening of the result of that action to appear within the mirror of karma.

original: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa mchog ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa mchog ni /
translated: Furthermore, the supreme generosity with the Dharma is as follows.🔽It is

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: sems shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa /🔽'dod pa med par shes pa sbyin zhing yon tan 'ba' zhig mngon par rjod par byed /
analyzed: sems shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa / 'dod pa med par shes pa sbyin zhing yon tan 'ba' zhig mngon par rjod par byed /
translated: one who has thoroughly cultivated the mind,🔽who teaches the Dharma for the sake of others,🔽who is engaged in benefiting others,🔽who teaches the Dharma without desire,

original: gzhan la phan gdags par zhugs pa chos ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan gdags par zhugs pa chos ston pa yin te /
translated: and who expresses only good qualities.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs kyi ro myang ba las nges par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs kyi ro myang ba las nges par 'byung ba'am /
translated: one who teaches the Dharma in order to go beyond the experience of the faults of desire,

original: gzhan log pa'i lta ba la zhugs pa'ang chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan log pa'i lta ba la zhugs pa'ang chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'jog par byed cing /
translated: and who establishes others who are engaged in false views in the Dharma and Vinaya,

original: chos 'dul ba skyon med pa'ang ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba skyon med pa'ang ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: and who teaches the faultless Dharma and Vinaya.

original: 'di ni chos sbyin pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos sbyin pa mchog yin no //
translated: This is the supreme generosity with the Dharma.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni byang chub tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni byang chub tu 'gyur te /
translated: Its result is awakening,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: perfect complete buddhahood,

original: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: knowledge,

original: bla na med pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: bla na med pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: the unsurpassed,🔽the guide who tames beings,

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: the teacher of gods and humans.

original: chos 'dul ba bla na med pa thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba bla na med pa thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba /
translated: The Dharma-Vinaya is unsurpassed, virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: de ni chos sbyin pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos sbyin pa mchog yin no //
translated: This is the supreme gift of the Dharma.

original: de ltar brgya byin des las kyi mi @325b long gi rtsig ngos la rnam pa du ma yod pa lha rnams la ston par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar brgya byin des las kyi mi @325b long gi rtsig ngos la rnam pa du ma yod pa lha rnams la ston par byed de /
translated: In this way, Śakra will show the gods the various aspects of the wall of karmic agents.

original: de ltar thams cad ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad ston par byed do //
translated: In this way, he will show them everything.

original: 'di ltar lha gzhan gang yin pa dag la mngon par brtags na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha gzhan gang yin pa dag la mngon par brtags na /
translated: When the other gods have examined this,

analyzed: lha de dag kun nas shin tu ngo tsha bar gyur pa dang / de dag la de ltar ma byed cig /
translated: they will all feel extremely embarrassed and he will tell them, ‘Do not act like this.

analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa dang / srid par rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu mngon par 'grub bo zhes bstan te /
translated: In this way, causes and conditions in cyclic existence will produce their effects.’

analyzed: de ltar zla ba bas lhag pa'i lus gang yin pa de dag mthong nas /
translated: When they see that their bodies are superior to the moon,

analyzed: bdag gi drung du lhags pa de dag nyid la bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: they will come before me and I will teach them.

analyzed: las byas pa 'di las tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog dang gsum po 'di dag lha rnams la bstan pa yin te /
translated: “ ‘These three—inferior, middling, and superior—are the results of actions that have been demonstrated to the gods.

analyzed: lha dag ngo tshe bar byas pa des chog chog /
translated: Enough with the gods’ shame!

original: de nas lha de rnams kyis ma mthong ba ngo mtshar che ba de la mngon par brtags nas 'khor ba la shin tu yid skyo ba rnams kyis 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: de nas lha de rnams kyis ma mthong ba ngo mtshar che ba de la mngon par brtags nas 'khor ba la shin tu yid skyo ba rnams kyis 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: “ ‘Then, as the gods observe that amazing sight that they have never seen before, those who are utterly disenchanted with cyclic existence will utter the following verses:

original: 'dod pa don med rgyags pas myos //
analyzed: 'dod pa don med rgyags pas myos //
translated: “ ‘Meaningless desires intoxicate the arrogant.

original: lha rnams rang bzhin stobs chung ba //
analyzed: lha rnams rang bzhin stobs chung ba //
translated: The gods are naturally weak.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyis 'khyam zhing rtse //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyis 'khyam zhing rtse //
translated: They wander and play in desire,

original: 'jigs pa chen po mi mthong ngo; ;'dod pa mi phan byed rnams la //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po mi mthong ngo; ;'dod pa mi phan byed rnams la //
translated: but do not see the great danger.

original: lha gang yid ni rton byed pa //🔽legs byas zad nas blun po dag /
analyzed: lha gang yid ni rton byed pa // legs byas zad nas blun po dag /
translated: “ ‘The gods who trust in desires,🔽which are harmful,🔽will later, when their good actions are exhausted,

original: phyi nas so sor rig par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas so sor rig par 'gyur //
translated: realize that they are fools.

original: lha rnams la ni bye brag tu //
analyzed: lha rnams la ni bye brag tu //
translated: “ ‘The gods in particular

original: phun sum ldan pa mod la 'jig /
analyzed: phun sum ldan pa mod la 'jig /
translated: are instantly destroyed by their perfect qualities.

original: ji lta ji ltar bde dang dga'//
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar bde dang dga'//
translated: The more pleasure and joy

original: de 'jig de ltar nyon mongs so //🔽gang tshe lha yi 'jig rten nas //
analyzed: de 'jig de ltar nyon mongs so // gang tshe lha yi 'jig rten nas //
translated: Thus, the afflictions are destroyed.🔽When a god falls from the world of the gods

original: sems can dmyal bar lha lhung ba //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar lha lhung ba //
translated: into the hells,🔽he is tormented everywhere

original: lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal @326a *//🔽gyis // thams cad du ni gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal @326a *// gyis // thams cad du ni gnod par 'gyur //
translated: by the suffering of body and mind.

original: de yi sdug bsngal shin tu tsha //
analyzed: de yi sdug bsngal shin tu tsha //
translated: His suffering is intense,

original: de ni tshad gzung mi nus so //🔽sdug bsngal rnams kyi nang na mchog /
analyzed: de ni tshad gzung mi nus so // sdug bsngal rnams kyi nang na mchog /
translated: and it cannot be measured.🔽Among all sufferings,

original: 'bral ba sdug bsngal yongs su rjod //
analyzed: 'bral ba sdug bsngal yongs su rjod //
translated: separation is said to be the worst.

original: de yang lha yi tshogs nang na //
analyzed: de yang lha yi tshogs nang na //

analyzed: gtso bor rtag tu yang dag 'jug / sems kyis yongs su bslus pa yi //

original: lha rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ngo //

original: 'dod pas shin tu bslus pa rnams //
analyzed: 'dod pas shin tu bslus pa rnams //
translated: Those who are completely deceived by desire

original: de ltar bzang ba skad cig ste //🔽brgya dang 'bum dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: de ltar bzang ba skad cig ste // brgya dang 'bum dang de bzhin du //
translated: have only a moment of pleasure,🔽whether it be a hundred, a thousand,

original: bya ba ther 'bum phrag brgya yi //
analyzed: bya ba ther 'bum phrag brgya yi //
translated: or even a hundred billion times.

original: 'dod pa thob kyang 'jig 'gyur pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa thob kyang 'jig 'gyur pa //
translated: But when they fall,

original: de la mi dag yid ma rton //
analyzed: de la mi dag yid ma rton //
translated: people should not rely on it.

original: legs par byas pa'i las kyi rgyus //
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las kyi rgyus //
translated: By the power of their good karma,

original: de yi 'bras bu rtag tu bde //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu rtag tu bde //

analyzed: shing nyams 'bras bu med pa ltar //

analyzed: bag med de nyid mthong rnams kyis //

analyzed: srog zad byed pa dug ltar mthong //

original: rtag tu me ltar sreg byed cing //
analyzed: rtag tu me ltar sreg byed cing //

analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyis lha shin tu bag med pas gnas pa dag rig nas tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams su rtser dong ngo //
translated: Then Śakra, knowing that the gods are dwelling in utter carelessness, goes to play in the forests and parks.

original: de nas yang lha rnam par g-yengs pa de rnams dang / shin tu yi chad pa dag dang yang lhan cig shing s'a la zung gnyis pa ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas /🔽de bzhin du des sdong po de nyid kyi sgo 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: de nas yang lha rnam par g-yengs pa de rnams dang / shin tu yi chad pa dag dang yang lhan cig shing s'a la zung gnyis pa ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas / de bzhin du des sdong po de nyid kyi sgo 'byed par byed do //
translated: Then, together with the gods who are utterly distracted and utterly despondent, he goes to the twin sāla trees.🔽In the same way, he opens the door of the tree trunk.

original: 'byed pa dang / de bzhin du sgo bye ste /
analyzed: 'byed pa dang / de bzhin du sgo bye ste /
translated: As it opens, the door opens in the same way.

original: brgya byin de lha de rnams dang lhan cig de nyid du zhugs pa dang lha rnams kyis tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal nyams dga' ba /
analyzed: brgya byin de lha de rnams dang lhan cig de nyid du zhugs pa dang lha rnams kyis tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal nyams dga' ba /
translated: Śakra will enter there together with the gods. The gods will see the delightful groves and parks,

original: sngon chad gar yang ma mthong ba'i dga' ba gang yin pa de dag dang 'dod pa thams cad 'byor ba /
analyzed: sngon chad gar yang ma mthong ba'i dga' ba gang yin pa de dag dang 'dod pa thams cad 'byor ba /

analyzed: bya rnam pa sna tshogs kun nas long long por 'khod pa /

original: padma'i tshal gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: padma'i tshal gyis brgyan pa /

original: gser btso ma'i shing ljon pas kun nas 'khrigs pa thams cad du mthong na dga' zhing yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: gser btso ma'i shing ljon pas kun nas 'khrigs pa thams cad du mthong na dga' zhing yid du 'ong ba /

original: 'jig rten gyi bde ba'i mchog blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bde ba'i mchog blta na sdug pa /
translated: It is the most delightful place in the world.

original: rlung bsten na bde ba /
analyzed: rlung bsten na bde ba /

original: ri'i zom yang rin po che'i rdo sna bdun gyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: ri'i zom yang rin po che'i rdo sna bdun gyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: The mountain peaks are adorned with the seven precious substances.

analyzed: bya rnam pa sna @329b tshogs skad 'byin pa mthong ngo //

analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing nyi ma ltar gzi che bas kun nas gsal ba yin te /
translated: The wish-fulfilling trees shine like the sun.

analyzed: nyi ma lta bu de rnams kyis shing s'a la'i nang de dag thams cad rnam par gsal ba /
translated: The sun-like trees illuminate everything in the forest.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba'i chu bo'ang dri dang / ro dang / mdog sna tshogs su 'bab pa rnams mthu rab tu che bar 'bab pa /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba'i chu bo'ang dri dang / ro dang / mdog sna tshogs su 'bab pa rnams mthu rab tu che bar 'bab pa /

original: de'i nang na dri shin tu mi bzad par zhim po yod de /
analyzed: de'i nang na dri shin tu mi bzad par zhim po yod de /

analyzed: yon tan sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa de rnams snas rim gyis shin tu myong bar byed do //

analyzed: de ltar dbang po lnga rnams kyi yul lnga sems dang ldan pa ltar sdug par ston pa /
translated: In this way, the five objects of the five senses are presented as beautiful and endowed with consciousness.

original: nyi ma nub pa ltar mi rtag ste /🔽phral 'phral la byung ba'i stobs kyis /
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa ltar mi rtag ste / phral 'phral la byung ba'i stobs kyis /
translated: However, they are impermanent, like the setting sun.🔽The gods are powerful, but

analyzed: dbang du gyur pa'i lha gang yin pa de rnams kyis dbang po'ang shin tu bde ba nyid yin na /🔽gang las bar mas nye bar 'gro ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: the gods who are under the power of impermanence will experience the highest bliss, let alone those who are in the intermediate state.

translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, shows them all the delightful groves and parks.
